intro: Jacksonia nematoclada, commonly known as the narrowleaf waratah, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, red or orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in coastal or subalpine habitats. It is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with a woody stem and dense foliage. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
